column.name: name
column.value: Koutoubia Mosque

column.name: description
column.value: The Koutoubia, an essential starting point for exploring the Medina of Marrakech, is a prestigious legacy of the Almoravid and Almohad dynasties. Close to Djemaa el Fna square, it is the largest mosque in the city, dating back 9 centuries.

column.name: name
column.value: Jemaa el Fna Square

column.name: description
column.value: Djemaa el-Fna Square in Marrakech, Morocco, is a lively hub both during the day and at night. Merchants, musicians, and snake charmers create an enchanting atmosphere at the heart of the Medina. A unique sensory experience.

column.name: name
column.value: Bahia Palace

column.name: description
column.value: Bahia Palace in Marrakech is an architectural marvel. Its lush gardens and sumptuous halls offer immersion into the opulence of the era. A historical treasure to discover.

column.name: name
column.value: Ben Youssef Madrasa

column.name: description
column.value: Ben Youssef Madrasa in Marrakech is a gem of Islamic architecture. Its courtyards adorned with mosaics and artistic details reflect the richness of Moroccan history and culture. A captivating immersion into the past.

column.name: name
column.value: El Badi Palace

column.name: description
column.value: El Badi Palace is a majestic ruin, a testimony to past grandeur. Its vast courtyards and imposing walls evoke a bygone era. An intriguing exploration of the city's historical heritage.

column.name: name
column.value: Saadian Tombs

column.name: description
column.value: The Saadian Tombs in Marrakech are a hidden treasure of sepulchral elegance. These 16th-century mausoleums exude an aura of mystery and solemnity. A silent experience at the heart of Moroccan history.

column.name: name
column.value: Menara Gardens

column.name: description
column.value: The Menara Gardens in Marrakech are a haven of natural peace. With its vast basin and iconic pavilion, the garden offers a serene escape amidst the bustling city. A tranquil oasis steeped in history and beauty.

column.name: name
column.value: Bab Agnaou

column.name: description
column.value: Bab Agnaou, a 12th-century gateway to Marrakech's Medina, boasts striking red sandstone walls and intricate carvings. It's a window into Morocco's rich past, offering a brief yet captivating glimpse into the city's history and architectural legacy.

column.name: name
column.value: Bab Er Robb

column.name: description
column.value: Bab er Robb, a 12th-century gate in Marrakech's Medina, whispers tales of ancient splendor. Its sturdy walls and subtle adornments offer a glimpse into the city's storied past, inviting curiosity about its rich history.

column.name: name
column.value: Kasbah Mosque

column.name: description
column.value: Kasbah Mosque, a serene landmark in Marrakech's Kasbah district, radiates timeless elegance and spiritual significance. With its graceful minaret and intricate faÃ§ade, it offers a glimpse into Morocco's rich architectural heritage and spiritual tradition

column.name: description
column.value: The Tanneries of Marrakech, nestled within the Medina, are vibrant hubs of traditional leathercraft. Here, amidst bustling workshops, artisans transform raw hides into fine leather goods, offering visitors a brief yet immersive glimpse into the city's rich cultural heritage.

column.name: name
column.value: Majorelle Garden

column.name: description
column.value: Majorelle Garden in Marrakech is a serene oasis created by Jacques Majorelle. Amidst lush greenery and vibrant blue structures, visitors find a tranquil escape from the city's hustle and bustle, a brief yet refreshing retreat into nature's beauty.

column.name: name
column.value: Almoravid Koubba

column.name: description
column.value: The Almoravid Koubba in Marrakech is a centuries-old architectural marvel. With its intricate designs and rich history, it offers a brief yet captivating glimpse into the city's Islamic heritage.
